trial_identification.studytitle: A prospective study of the impact upon serum electrolyte and magnesium levels of using magnesium sulfate for bowel preparation for colonoscopy.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A prospective study of the impact upon serum electrolyte and magnesium levels of using magnesium sulfate for bowel preparation for colonoscopy.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal oral and gastrointestinal development and function

interventions.interventions: Colocap Balance (TM) 61.75gm magnesium sulfate, encapsulated (65 capsules). Patients will take 65 capsules orally, in batches of 5 with 250ml fluid, every 15 minutes, over a period of approximately 3 hours.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To assess the difference in serum magnesium, urea, creatinine and electrolytes before and after ingesting 61.75gm dried magnesium sulfate.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: PRE: Up to one week prior to taking bowel preparation, and POST: during colonoscopy procedure.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To assess the efficacy of the preparation using the colonoscopists evaluation of the quality of the bowel clean.
To assess the acceptability of the bowel preparation to patients using their reports of palatability, ease of use and tolerability.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: After taking bowel preparation, immediately before procedure.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Renal insufficiency; current chronic inflammatory bowel disease.
